data.name: Base 10 to any Base
data.description:
The purpose of this kata is to convert a given number in base 10 to any base up to base 64. To standardize output, we will use the given order for all the bases. 

```
base64 = '0123456789ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZabcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz+/'
```
So for n<sup>th</sup> base, we will take the first n values of the ```base64``` string representation.

For example:
```
base20 = '0123456789ABCDEFGHIL' 
    or the first 20 characters from base64. 
```
The function takes two inputs ```(n, b)```, n is the number in base 10, and b is the base to be converted to. The result is a string. 

So, a few examples to demonstrate what is expected of this kata,
```ruby
to_any_base(100, 2) => '1100100'
to_any_base(100, 8) => '144'
to_any_base(100,16) => '64'
to_any_base(100,28) => '3G'
to_any_base(100,60) => '1e'
```
```javascript
toAnyBase(100, 2) => '1100100'
toAnyBase(100, 8) => '144'
toAnyBase(100,16) => '64'
toAnyBase(100,28) => '3G'
toAnyBase(100,60) => '1e'
```
You will return ```false``` for base 0. And before you start stressing out, base input will never be greater than 64. 

To end this on a smart note... damn, I swear to god I had something for this.
